items.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: Last 24 hours for 2-for-1 Pass
items.summary:
- Final opportunity for 2-for-1 Passes for TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 until tonight at 11:59 p.m. PT.
- Event scheduled for October 27-29, 2025 in San Francisco at Moscone West.
- Features AI topics, expert discussions, startup pitch competitions, and networking opportunities.
- Unique opportunity to purchase one pass at a discounted rate and receive a second pass for nearly free.
- Last chance to secure tickets at the lowest rates before the offer ends.

items.title: The TechCrunch Cyber Glossary
items.summary:
- A comprehensive glossary of cybersecurity terms created by TechCrunch.
- Includes common and less common jargon used in cybersecurity articles.
- The glossary will be regularly updated and invites user feedback.
- Key entries include definitions for terms like Advanced Persistent Threat, Backdoor, and DDoS.
- Addresses the significance of proper terminology in understanding cybersecurity incidents.

items.title: US nonprofit healthcare provider says hackers stole medical and personal data of 1M+ patients
items.summary:
- Community Health Center (CHC), a nonprofit healthcare provider in Connecticut, reported that hackers stole sensitive data of over a million patients.
- The breach was detected on January 2, 2025, with unauthorized access starting on October 14, 2024.
- The hacked data may include personal identifiers like addresses, phone numbers, Social Security numbers, and health information.

items.title: Apple Intelligence will support more languages from April
items.summary:
- Apple Intelligence will add support for French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Japanese, Korean, and simplified Chinese in April 2025.
- CEO Tim Cook announced this during the Q4 2024 results call.
- Earlier, the AI suite only supported U.S. English and localized English for various countries was added in the December 2024 update.
- No plans have been disclosed for rollout in the EU and Mainland China yet.
- A new version of Siri that understands on-screen context will be released in the coming months.

items.title: In another challenging year for startups, higher valuations and revenue give reason for hope
items.author: Anna Heim
items.summary:
- Voi reported its first profitable year, setting the stage for a potential IPO.
- OpenAI-backed 1X acquired Kind Humanoid, a robotics startup working with designer Yves Béhar.
- Alan, a French health insurance startup, generated $525 million in revenue and aims for profitability by 2026.
- Helion raised $425 million for nuclear fusion, with a valuation of $5.245 billion.
- TravelPerk's valuation nearly doubled to $2.7 billion after a $200 million funding round.
- ElevenLabs raised $180 million at a $3.3 billion valuation, focused on AI audio technology.
- 2025 is predicted to be another difficult year for startups, though some funding levels remain robust.

items.title: Intel has already received $2.2B in federal grants for chip production
Pentagon scrambles to block DeepSeek after employees connect to Chinese servers
items.summary:
- DeepSeek explicitly states it stores user data on Chinese servers governed by Chinese law.
- U.S. Department of Defense employees connected to DeepSeek for at least two days before the Pentagon began blocking it.
- The U.S. government is concerned about national security implications due to the growing popularity of DeepSeek.

items.title: Apple tops 1 billion subscriptions, nearly $100B in services revenue in 2024
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Apple reported a record revenue of $26.3 billion for its Services division for Q4 2024, up 14% year-over-year.
- The company achieved nearly $100 billion in Services revenue over the past year and has more than 1 billion subscriptions.
- Engagement for Apple’s services, including paid accounts, grew by double digits year over year.
- Apple Arcade and Fitness+ continue to expand, and Tap to Pay for iPhone is now available in 20 markets.
- The company faces regulatory scrutiny but maintains positive customer engagement numbers across all offerings.
- The U.S. Supreme Court declined to hear the Epic Games case, affirming that Apple is not a monopolist, but requiring it to allow developers to link to external payment options.

items.title: Apple CEO says DeepSeek shows ‘innovation that drives efficiency’
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- Apple CEO Tim Cook described DeepSeek’s AI models as "innovation that drives efficiency" during an earnings call.
- Cook emphasized that Apple uses a hybrid AI model, conducting simple tasks locally and complex tasks via cloud partnerships.
- OpenAI claims its models were used to train DeepSeek’s AI models, which could violate usage policies.
- Apple’s partnership with OpenAI is non-exclusive, with potential for future collaborations with other AI firms.
- Analysis indicates DeepSeek’s AI models may not have been trained as efficiently as claimed, yet they are sold at lower prices than U.S. counterparts.
- Apple’s AI features rollout hasn't significantly boosted iPhone sales, which slightly declined compared to the previous year.
- The company paused misleading AI-driven news summaries after generating incorrect alerts.

items.title: Google quietly announces its next flagship AI model
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Google's next-gen flagship AI model, Gemini 2.0 Pro Experimental, was announced in the changelog for the Gemini app without a major launch event.
- It succeeds the Gemini 1.5 Pro model launched in February and aims to improve factuality and performance in coding and mathematics tasks.
- Available to Gemini Advanced users, the model is in early preview and may have unexpected behaviors and lack real-time information access.
- Coinciding with this launch, the Gemini 2.0 Flash model is now available to all users in the Gemini app.

items.title: Intel Won't Bring Its Falcon Shores AI Chip to Market
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Intel has decided to discontinue the Falcon Shores AI chip, focusing on internal testing only.
- The decision follows disappointing product launches and losses as competitors like AMD and Nvidia create challenges.
- Intel co-CEO Michelle Johnston Holthaus emphasized the need to focus on Jaguar Shores for a comprehensive AI data center solution.
- Holthaus stated that the cloud-based AI data center market is currently a weak point for Intel, indicating plans for resource allocation to correct this.
- Previous AI chip Gaudi 3 was also considered a failure, affecting sales expectations and service provider commitments.

items.title: Apple quarterly revenue increases, even as China sales decline 11%
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
• Apple reported Q1 2025 revenue of $124.3 billion, a 4% increase year-over-year.
• Net income rose to $36.33 billion, up 7.1% from $33.92 billion in Q1 2024.
• iPhone sales dropped 11.1% in China, marking the largest decline since Q1 2024.
• CEO Tim Cook attributed some challenges to the absence of Apple Intelligence in key markets.
• Both Mac and iPad revenue grew by 15% due to new product launches; services increased by 14%.
• Active device install base reached 2.35 billion, with one billion subscriptions across offerings.

items.title: Elon Musk reveals Elon Musk was wrong about Full Self-Driving
items.author: Sean O'Kane
items.summary:
- Elon Musk admitted that Tesla cars with Hardware 3 need an upgrade for unsupervised self-driving software.
- Hardware 3 vehicles, sold from 2019 to 2023, were equipped with older computing technology, not suited for full autonomy.
- This admission highlights Musk's previous overpromises regarding Tesla's self-driving capabilities since 2016.
- Tesla's claim that all vehicles had necessary hardware has since been disavowed and a blog post stating this was removed.
- Musk indicated that 2025 could be a pivotal year for Tesla with plans for a pilot program in Austin to demonstrate self-driving capabilities.

items.title: OpenAI said to be in talks to raise $40B at a $340B valuation
items.summary:
- OpenAI is reportedly in talks to raise up to $40 billion, aiming for a $340 billion valuation.
- SoftBank is expected to lead the investment round, contributing between $15 billion to $25 billion.
- The funding will support OpenAI's ongoing operations and its Stargate project to build AI data centers across the U.S.
- In 2024, OpenAI faced a loss of approximately $5 billion against $3.7 billion in revenue, indicating potential growth challenges.

items.title: Controversial genetics testing startup Nucleus Genomics raises $14M Series A
items.summary:
- Nucleus Genomics, founded by Kian Sadeghi, raised $14M Series A, totaling $32M in funding.
- The startup offers saliva DNA sequencing to identify predispositions to various health issues.
- Founders Fund partner Delian Asparouhov backs Sadeghi’s vision for accessible genetic testing tailored to personal health needs.
- The cost of genome sequencing has dropped significantly, now around $400, with expectations of further reductions.
- Sadeghi’s motivation comes from a personal tragedy involving a cousin's unknown genetic condition.
- Nucleus IQ, a service launched last year, assesses genetic correlations with intelligence but has faced criticism for its methodology and implications.

items.title: Fintech startup Cushion shuts down after 8 years and over $20 million in funding
items.author: Paul Kesserwani
items.summary:
- Cushion, a fintech startup, has shut down after eight years and $21.6 million in funding.
- Founded in late 2016, Cushion aimed to automate bank fee negotiation for consumers.
- The company reached $3 million ARR in 10 months and had over 1 million consumers, but couldn't achieve sustainable scale.
- Its last funding round was a $12 million Series A closed in May 2022, with a post-money valuation of $82.4 million.
- Founder Paul Kesserwani expressed pride in what the company accomplished despite the shutdown.

items.title: Serial founder DIVINE launches creator app with hip hop legend RAKIM
items.author: Dominic-Madori Davis
items.summary:
- Victor D. Lombard, also known as DIVINE, launches fintech app called Notes for independent urban musicians in partnership with hip-hop icon RAKIM.
- Notes provides tools for financial management, credit score tracking, education on monetizing music, and a collaborative platform for lyric writing.
- The app features an AI voice assistant in RAKIM’s voice and aims for a full launch by the end of February 2025.

items.title: AngelSense exposed location data and personal information of tracked users
items.author: Zack Whittaker
items.summary:
- AngelSense exposed users' personally identifiable information and location data online.
- The server was secured only after UpGuard alerted the company on January 14.
- Exposed data included names, addresses, health information, and authentication tokens.
- CEO Doron Somer confirmed the company only acted after a call from UpGuard.
- Investigation ongoing to assess if data was accessed or misused; no evidence of misuse found yet.

items.title: Google’s ‘Ask for Me’ feature calls businesses on your behalf to inquire about services, pricing
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Google is testing a new AI-driven feature called “Ask for Me” that calls local businesses for service and pricing information.
- Available on desktop and mobile for users in Google’s Search Labs, it allows inquiries without direct phone calls.
- Users can search for local services and select “Ask for Me” to get started, entering service details and timeframes.
- The AI calls businesses, providing users with summaries of prices and availability, streamlining the process of obtaining information.
- This feature follows another called “Talk to a Live Rep” from last year, which waits on hold for live assistance before connecting users.

items.title: a16z has venture scouts scattered across Europe
items.summary:
- Despite closing its London crypto-focused office, Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) has numerous scouts across Europe searching for early-stage startups.
- Scouts are located in several countries including Sweden, France, Germany, Estonia, the U.K., and Amsterdam.
- Scout investments range from $10,000 to $25,000, with a limit of eight deals per year, and they are not allowed to invest directly in NFTs.

items.title: Google issues ‘voluntary exit’ program for Android, Chrome, and Pixel employees
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Google announced a "voluntary exit program" for its Pixel, Android, and Chrome team employees.
- The program provides severance packages for US-based employees wishing to leave.
- This decision follows a merger of the Android, Pixel hardware, and Chrome teams into the "Platform and Devices" division.
- The initiative aims to enhance commitment and focus on product development.
- The exit program does not affect Google's AI and search divisions.
- The memo was issued after Amazon made layoffs in its corporate responsibility divisions.

items.title: Boom goes supersonic and Elon promises a self-driving service by summer
items.author: Elon Musk
items.summary:
- Elon Musk announced a paid ride-hailing service with driverless vehicles to launch in Austin by June 2025.
- The announcement was made during Tesla's fourth-quarter and full-year earnings call.
- Details about the service's operational constraints and specifics remain unclear, stirring excitement in light of Tesla's flat automotive business.
- Boom Supersonic's XB-1 demonstrator became the first civil aircraft to exceed Mach 1, achieving supersonic flight over California.

items.title: Amazon cuts jobs in Sustainability department
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- Amazon is eliminating jobs in the Communications and Sustainability departments due to its return to office policy.
- CEO Andy Jassy announced a full return to the office five days a week starting in 2025, which faced employee backlash.
- SVP Drew Herdener indicated roles were too narrowly scoped or needed restructuring, but overall headcount will not change as lower level positions will be filled.
- The exact number of jobs eliminated has not been disclosed, but affected employees will receive support and assistance.
- These cuts come amid broader restructuring and relate to the administration's shifting stance on sustainability initiatives after Donald Trump's inauguration.

items.title: US Justice Department says cybercrime forum allegedly affected 17 million Americans
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary:
- On Thursday, an international coalition took down two prominent hacking forums, Cracked and Nulled.
- The forums allegedly affected at least 17 million Americans, involving serious cases like cyberstalking and identity theft.
- Cracked had over 4 million users since 2018, generating around $4 million in revenue, while Nulled had over 5 million users and around $1 million in annual revenue.

items.title: Microsoft signs massive carbon credit deal with reforestation startup Chestnut Carbon
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- Microsoft announced a 25-year deal to purchase over 7 million tons of carbon credits from Chestnut Carbon.
- The deal aims to support reforestation of 60,000 acres across Arkansas, Louisiana, and Texas.
- Microsoft has faced rising emissions due to increased data center usage prompted by AI, with a reported 29% increase in emissions since 2020.
- The carbon credits from Chestnut Carbon are focused on reforestation and monitoring of new forests.
- Premium carbon credits from diverse, native plantings sell at a higher price compared to those from non-native trees.
- The cost of Chestnut Carbon's credits is $34 per ton, significantly lower than direct air capture costs, which range from $600 to $1,000 per ton.
- After an investigation into Verra raised concerns about the quality of nature-based carbon credits, Chestnut Carbon has shifted to using Gold Standard for certification.

items.title: Waymo employees can hail fully autonomous rides in Atlanta now
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary:
- Waymo is launching fully driverless robotaxi rides for employees in Atlanta.
- This service is a precursor to public availability expected later in 2025.
- The launch follows a $5.6 billion Series C funding round at a $45 billion valuation.
- Waymo plans to test in 10 new cities in 2025, starting with San Diego and Las Vegas.
- The commercial robotaxi service will be available exclusively via the Uber app in Atlanta.
- Waymo has previously opened rides to the public in Austin in October 2024 and runs services in San Francisco, Phoenix, and Los Angeles.

items.title: Factorial Capital takes a fresh approach to finding startups with a technical edge
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary:
- Matt Hartman emphasizes the need for venture capitalists to deeply understand technology, particularly in startups focused on AI.
- Hartman founded Factorial Capital after nine years at Betaworks, aiming for a new approach in startup investment.
- Factorial relies on a network of technical founders to identify startups pre-product market fit, allowing for better investment strategies.
- The firm has partnered with prominent figures like Giphy's Alex Chung and Venmo's Iqram Magdon-Ismail to source deals.
- Factorial aims to make larger investments (typically $500,000) while allowing sourcing partners to invest their own money as well.

items.title: US Justice Department sues to block HPE’s $14B acquisition of Juniper Networks
items.summary:
- The U.S. Department of Justice has sued to block HPE's acquisition of Juniper Networks, citing antitrust concerns.
- The DOJ argues the deal would reduce competition in the enterprise wireless equipment market from three major vendors to two.
- HPE announced its intention to acquire Juniper for $14 billion in January 2024, promoting the deal as a way to enhance AI solutions.
- The European Commission approved the acquisition in August 2024, but the U.S. government expressed skepticism regarding competition implications in the American market.

items.title: How DeepSeek changed Silicon Valley’s AI landscape
items.summary:
- Chinese AI lab [DeepSeek](https://techcrunch.com/2025/01/28/deepseek-everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-ai-chatbot-app/) has released competitive AI models, causing significant concern among Silicon Valley tech companies and the U.S. government.
- DeepSeek's models are offered at lower prices than counterparts from OpenAI, Meta, and Google, leading to fear of China advancing in the AI arms race.
- The launch of DeepSeek’s R1 model utilized a pure reinforcement learning approach, indicating a new way for AI to learn from experience, enhancing confidence in the progress of AI development.

items.title: ElevenLabs, the hot AI audio startup, confirms $180M in Series C funding at a $3.3B valuation
items.summary:
- ElevenLabs raises $180 million in Series C funding at a $3.3 billion valuation.
- The funding co-led by a16z and ICONIQ Growth will enhance ElevenLabs' audio tools and business development.
- The startup focuses on developing expressive audio AI models and multimodal interactions.
- New investors include NEA, World Innovation Lab, and Abu Dhabi's Lunate, with participation from existing backers like Sequoia Capital.
- ElevenLabs has previously raised a total of $281 million, including an $80 million Series B last year.
- The company also aims to improve AI conversational agents and increase its consumer-facing products, such as ElevenLabs Reader.

items.title: Threads adds a ‘media’ tab and the ability to tag people in photos
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Meta introduces a dedicated “media” tab for photos and videos on Threads.
- Users can now tag people in shared photos.
- The new tab aims to help users showcase their media and is a response to community requests.
- Launched after Threads reached 320 million monthly active users, a notable increase from 300 million last month.
- Competitors include X (formerly Twitter) and Bluesky, both of which have also launched similar features recently.
- Accompanying features include a “markup” tool that adds commentary on posts, rolling out globally.

items.title: Mark Zuckerberg teases a 2025 return to ‘OG Facebook’
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced plans for a "return to OG Facebook" as a goal for 2025 during the Q4 earnings call.
- Specific changes remain undisclosed, but the focus is on restoring cultural influence and attracting younger users.
- Changes could affect short-term revenues and are expected to start rolling out in about six months.
- Declining interest from Gen Z users poses a challenge, with studies showing they prefer TikTok, Instagram, and Snapchat.
- Previous efforts to appeal to younger audiences, such as a college-focused platform, have failed.
- Meta’s new approach will build upon a Gen Z-focused redesign launched in October 2024, amidst competition from emerging social networks.

items.title: Data center operator DataBank nets $250M equity investment
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- DataBank raised $250 million from private equity firm TJC and $600 million from a secondary share offer.
- The investment reflects growing demand in the data center market driven by AI.
- DataBank operates over 65 data centers across more than 27 markets and has raised $5 billion in the past year and a half.

items.title: Ex-Autodesk execs snag $46M to build the next gen of architecture design
items.author: Marina Temkin
items.summary:
- Former Autodesk executives Amar Hanspal and Brian Matthews are launching a new architecture design platform called [Motif](https://www.motif.io/).
- Motif has raised $46 million, combining seed and Series A funding led by Capital G and Redpoint Ventures.
- The platform aims to provide cloud-native 3D CAD tools incorporating AI and machine learning, addressing frustrations with current non-cloud-based tools.

items.title: International police coalition takes down two prolific cybercrime and hacking forums
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary:
- International law enforcement coalition took down two major hacking forums, Cracked and Nulled, hosting over 10 million users.
- Operation, named "Operation Talent," involved multiple agencies, with significant seizures including 17 servers and €300,000.
- Two German suspects were arrested; further actions are pending against additional individuals across multiple countries.

items.title: Amazon hikes prices for its Music Unlimited subscriptions
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Amazon increases price of Music Unlimited Individual plan for Prime members from $9.99 to $10.99.
- Non-Prime subscribers see their price go from $10.99 to $11.99.
- Family plan pricing rises from $16.99 to $19.99 per month.
- Changes align Amazon's prices more closely with Spotify's recent hikes.
- Price changes effective immediately for new customers, existing customers updated March 5, 2025.
- Previous price increase was in August 2023 for similar reasons of enhancing content and features.

items.title: OpenAI will offer its tech to US national labs for nuclear weapons research
items.summary:
- OpenAI plans to allow U.S. National Laboratories to use its AI models for nuclear weapons security and scientific projects.
- Collaboration with Microsoft to deploy a model on the supercomputer at Los Alamos National Laboratory.
- Focus on reducing the risk of nuclear war and securing nuclear materials, with researchers having security clearances involved in consultation.
- OpenAI emphasizes this partnership as a new era for advancing science and supporting U.S. national security initiatives.

items.title: Little Umbrella’s next Jackbox-style game pits you and your friends against an AI game show host
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Little Umbrella announced a $2 million seed funding round to accelerate its AI-powered social games.
- Three games are expected to launch in the coming year, including a new game titled The Last Show by AI, set for beta release in March 2025.
- Their flagship game, Death by AI, gained over 20 million players within the first three months of launch, showcasing the potential of AI in creating engaging social experiences.

items.title: Microsoft’s Copilot-focused Surface Pro and Laptop PCs ship with Snapdragon and Intel options
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
• Microsoft unveiled the Surface Pro and Surface Laptop, certified with Copilot+ for AI integration in Windows 11.
• Devices feature Intel Core Ultra (Series 2) or Snapdragon X processors, with Snapdragon promising extended battery life but lower performance compared to Intel.
• The Surface Laptop for business will add 5G connectivity later in 2025 to enhance local AI computing capabilities.
• Pricing starts at $1,500 for Intel models, a $400 premium over Snapdragon options.
• A new USB4 Dock, priced at $200, will be available alongside the new devices on February 18, 2025.

items.title: Mexican president pushes back against Google’s renaming of Gulf of Mexico
items.author: Claudia Sheinbaum
items.summary:
- Google Maps plans to rename Gulf of Mexico to Gulf of America following President Trump’s executive order.
- Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum announced that Mexico will question Google’s decision with a formal letter.
- Google stated it follows official government sources for name changes and shows names based on user location.

items.title: AI creations edited by humans can likely be copyrighted in US, agency says
items.summary:
- The U.S. Copyright Office stated that AI-generated creations edited by humans can be copyrighted.
- Creations without human edits, like purely AI-generated content, cannot be copyrighted.
- Copyright eligibility is determined on a case-by-case basis; prompts alone do not qualify for copyright.
- A follow-up report from the Copyright Office will address AI making independent artistic choices.

items.title: Backline automatically remediates security vulnerabilities
items.author: Frederic Lardinois
items.summary:
- Backline, a new AI-driven security startup, secures $9 million in seed funding from StageOne Ventures.
- Co-founded by Maor Goldberg, previous founder of Whitebox Security and Apolicy, alongside Eran Leib and Aviad Chen.
- Backline aims to alleviate the burden of security alerts on developers and security teams.
- The platform automates the remediation of vulnerabilities using AI agents to propose and implement fixes, followed by testing.
- Focused on addressing security backlogs that plague organizations, as highlighted by industry experts.

items.title: QED seeds $9.9M in Cedar Money, a stablecoin payment platform
items.summary:
- Cedar Money, a U.S.-based startup, raised $9.9 million in seed funding led by QED Investors.
- The platform aims to improve cross-border payments using stablecoins.
- It launched in early 2024, starting operations in Nigeria, targeting import and export businesses.
- Founder Benjy Feinberg emphasizes the challenges of compliance and transaction costs in developing regions like Africa.
- Cedar Money intends to scale payment infrastructure to alleviate inefficiencies in international payments.

items.title: Savant Labs is an automation platform for business analysts
items.author: Chitrang Shah
items.summary:
- Savant Labs launched its automation platform for data analysts in 2023, raising $18.5 million in Series A funding led by Dell Technologies Capital.
- Unlike other low-code/no-code tools, it focuses on business analysts, integrating a spreadsheet at the core of its user experience.
- The platform allows users to utilize Excel formulas and connect to various data sources, aiming to democratize analytics for larger businesses and set to expand to SMEs in the future.
- Savant's CEO, Chitrang Shah, highlights the innovation gap in legacy analytics tools and the growing demand for accessible data automation solutions.

items.title: Ai2 says its new AI model beats one of DeepSeek’s best
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Ai2 released its new AI model Tulu3-405B, claiming it outperforms DeepSeek V3 and OpenAI’s GPT-4o.
- Tulu3-405B has 405 billion parameters and was trained using 256 GPUs; it's open source and freely available.
- Ai2 aims to reinforce the U.S.'s position in open-source AI development, presenting Tulu3-405B as a competitive alternative to DeepSeek.
- The model achieved top results in benchmarks such as PopQA and GSM8K, beating several other models in its class.
- Tulu3-405B is available for testing via Ai2’s web app and the training code is accessible on GitHub.

items.title: DeepSeek exposed internal database containing chat histories and sensitive data
items.summary:
- Chinese AI company DeepSeek had an exposed back-end database containing sensitive information including user chat histories and API keys.
- The database was unprotected with a password, allowing public access to over a million unencrypted logs.
- Security researchers from Wiz discovered the database and notified DeepSeek, who subsequently took it offline.
- The exposed chat logs were primarily in Chinese but could be easily translated.
- It is unclear if other entities accessed the database before it was secured, or how long it had been exposed.
- Misconfiguration is likely due to human error; DeepSeek gained popularity since its launch in December.

items.title: Data analytics startup Athenic AI wants to be an enterprise’s central nervous system
items.author: Jared Zhao, Becca Szkutak
items.summary:
- Athenic AI, founded by Jared Zhao, aims to provide AI-driven data analytics for enterprises, described as a central nervous system for databases.
- Launched in Summer 2022, the startup has secured customers from small startups to large enterprises, including Additel and PMC.
- The company has announced a $4.3 million seed round led by BMW i Ventures to expand its team and technology capabilities.

items.title: US Blood Donation Giant Warns of Disruption After Ransomware Attack
items.author: Carly Page
items.summary:
- New York Blood Center (NYBC) is facing service disruptions due to a ransomware attack detected on January 26.
- NYBC provides blood to over 200 hospitals in the northeast U.S. and has warned that donation activities may be rescheduled and processing times could be longer than usual.
- The organization has declared a blood emergency, citing a 30% drop in donations, leading to dangerously low supplies of some blood types.

items.title: SuperOps bags $25M to use AI and better help managed service providers
items.author: Jagmeet Singh
items.summary:
- SuperOps, an Indian startup, raised $25 million in a Series C round, valuing it at $200 million.
- It aims to improve support for managed service providers (MSPs) with AI offerings.
- The startup has tripled its customer base to 1,300 across 104 countries.
- SuperOps launched a GPT-powered AI assistant, Monica, to enhance workflow automation for MSPs.
- The company plans to enter the mid-sized enterprise market and expand its geographic presence, including opening an office in London.
- Founded in 2020 by Arvind Parthiban and Jayakumar Karumbasalam, SuperOps aims for a 300% revenue increase this year.

items.title: India lauds Chinese AI lab DeepSeek, plans to host its models on local servers
items.author: Manish Singh
items.summary:
- India will host Chinese AI lab DeepSeek's large language models on domestic servers, marking a rare acceptance of Chinese technology.
- IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw highlighted DeepSeek's $5.5 million investment and powerful models amid criticism of India's own AI investments.
- DeepSeek models will be processed under strict data localization requirements, ensuring user data remains in India.
- The AI Compute Facility will utilize 18,693 GPUs, significantly exceeding initial targets, and offer discounted computing services.
- DeepSeek faced scrutiny as its app was removed from Apple and Google's stores in Italy over data privacy concerns.
- India aims to attract $30 billion in investment for hyperscalers and data centers in the coming years, enhancing its AI ecosystem.
